ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.secure

Class TaskWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.secure.TaskWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TaskWorker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A threaded implementation of a worker processing tasks required by an SSLEngine that is associated with a SecureSocket.

    The worker sequentially processes tasks that need to be completed, in a FIFO fashion, notifying the associated TaskListener once they have been completed. The TaskWorker is otherwise waiting for incoming tasks via the addSocket(SecureSocket) method.

    Since:
    0.18

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskWorker

        public TaskWorker(TaskListener listener)
        Create a TaskWorker instance with a single TaskListener reference. The TaskListener is notified whenever any task has finished being processed by the TaskWorker.
        Parameters:
        listener - The TaskListener to be notified of completed tasks

    • Method Detail

      • addSocket

        public void addSocket(SecureSocket socket)
        Add a SecureSocket with an underlying SSLEngine that requires a task to be run. Tasks are run in a FIFO queue according to order of socket insertion.
        Parameters:
        socket - The SecureSocket that requires a task to be run

      • run

        public void run()
        The run() method of the TaskWorker. Here, sequential processing of SSLEngine tasks that need to be completed is done in a FIFO fashion, notifying the associated TaskListener once they have been completed. The TaskWorker is otherwise waiting for incoming tasks via the addSocket(SecureSocket) method.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check whether the TaskWorker is running.
        Returns:
        true if it is running, false otherwise

      • setRunning

        public void setRunning(boolean running)
        Set the running status of the TaskWorker. If the running status of the worker is set to false, the TaskWorker is interrupted (if waiting for a task) in order to cleanly shutdown.
        Parameters:
        running - Whether the TaskWorker should run or not
